verses.roman:
kāṅhā tomāra kṛṣṇa-rasa-kāvya-sudhā-sindhu
tāra madhye mithyā kene stuti-kṣāra-bindu

synonyms: kāṅhā—where; tomāra—your; kṛṣṇa-rasa-kāvya—of exalted poetry concerning the mellows of Lord Kṛṣṇa's pastimes; sudhā-sindhu—ocean of the nectar; tāra madhye—within that; mithyā—false; kene—why; stuti—prayer; kṣāra-bindu—like a drop of alkali.
translation: Your exalted poetic descriptions of the mellows of Lord Kṛṣṇa's pastimes are like an ocean of nectar. But why have you put in a false prayer about Me? It is like a drop of detestful alkali."
